pageContext.description: Hilt transitional between dirk & sword. 4 rivet holes, 1 rivet.
pageContext.associations: Found with 1 palstave & 1 fragment of sword blade
pageContext.site: England,Essex,Southend-on-sea,Southchurch,Thorpe Hall Brickfield (about 1000 yds. E. of Thorpe Bay, L.M.S. Rly. Station),3 ft. 6 in. deep in brick earth containing fragments of bone & charcoal.,23rd February 1929
pageContext.toSearch: Southchurch, Southend-on-sea, Southend-on-sea, Southend-on-sea Ss1, UK
pageContext.remarks: The brickfield is worked to depth of 7 ft: beneath the earth is ballast & sand. Excavations around the site of discovery produced no additional objects.
